greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of even numbers that cannot be expressed as the difference p-q of two odd primes q < p <= prime(n).
comment: If a(n)=0, then Prime[n], called a cluster prime, is in A038134. If a(n)>0 then Prime[n] is in A038133.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Cluster Primes
example: a(25)=1 because Prime[25]=97 and there is 1 even number, 88, that cannot be written as the difference of two odd primes less than or equal to 97.
mathematica: m=10000; n=PrimePi[m]-1; p=Table[Prime[i+1], {i, n}]; d=Table[0, {m/2}]; c=Table[0, {n}]; For[i=2, i<=n, i++, For[j=1, j<i, j++, diff=p[[i]]-p[[j]]; d[[diff/2]]++ ]; c[[i]]=Count[Take[d, (p[[i]]-3)/2], 0]]; c
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Jul 15 2002, Nov 19 2006
